intro: Cyperus impubes var. brevispiculosus, commonly known as the short-bristled flatsedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the sedge family (Cyperaceae) and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typically found in dense clusters at the base of the plant. It thrives in wet or marshy environments and is often found in disturbed soils near water bodies. Due to its adaptability, it is considered an invasive species in some regions where it outcompetes native vegetation.
